Hi,
	This is not my field and doesn't really interest me (except that it's 
about MONEY, loverly MONEY, MONEY, MONEY...).

	Sorry, I feel better now.

	I just wondered could you use a different fitness function to avoid over 
fitting.  e.g. I think I am right in suggesting that over fitting tends to 
zero in on the best periods in your data, and then do so well on those that 
they dominate the average?  In that case, maybe if you looked at the 
distribution of profit/loss across the whole of the data in some manner.  e.g.

1) maybe striking out the top 5 profits before calculating an average

2) or, classify periods as "good", "poor" or "bad" and award a fitness 
based on only the number in each category.  So an extreme profit is still 
only a "good" and the best individual is the one with the most goods...

	Ian Badcoe
